Comments_List: This class taught me new ways to think about convergence of series, limits, continuity, and calculus in general. I hope I can continue to build on the lessons I've learned through it. Overall I enjoyed this course more than I expected to.
I learn a lot about basic real number structure
I think it's best to give answers to the practice questions in the syllabus.

Yes, yes, yes, absolutely yes. Real analysis is unbelievably fundamental to an unbelievable number of disciplines - mathematics of course, statistics, economics, finance, even engineering and the physical sciences. It shows you new ways to think and reason about things you might never have given a second thought to before, e.g., why CAN we derive or integrate? What do such things mean?
